s.text: The NYT plays up an interesting safety angle: Not only is smuggling laughably easy, it's potentially very dangerous.
Steve May was "outed" in his 1996 campaign for the Arizona State Senate, but the Army investigation began only after he spoke out against antigay cuts in health care benefits.

According to a front page NYT story, the army's investigation of an openly gay Republican state legislator who was also in the Army Reserves has re-ignited debate over the armed forces' "don't ask, don't tell" policy.
